titlestmt.titleproper: Music, Vocal and Instrumental, Associated with New Haven
New Haven, Associated Music, Vocal and Instrumental

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 00:01

did.unittitle: Music, Vocal and Instrumental, Associated with New Haven
did.abstract: Music, programs, and other items associated with New Haven, Connecticut

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Misc. Ms. 365, Music, Vocal and Instrumental, Associated with New Haven in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 3 series as follows: I. Music. II. Programs. III. Articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of musical scores associated with New Haven, Connecticut in various ways; for example, some have lyrics that mention New Haven or Yale, others were written by New Haven composers, and still others were published in New Haven. The collection also includes 111 concert programs (dating from 1860 to 1970), a 1941 newspaper article about the history of music in New Haven, and a list of New Haven references in Musical Review.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Jefferson's march / John F. Curtiss, Cheshire ca. 1800 -- Warren's march / John F. Curtiss ca. 1800 -- March of the disbanded troops / John Curtiss -- Duetto for 2 violins or 2 flutes / John F. Curtiss -- March in a midnight serenade / John Curtiss -- Amelia / John Curtiss -- Duettino-Rondo-Jigg / John F. Curtiss -- Col. Bellamy's March / from the Bellamy Band Book, Hamden, 1799 -- New Haven march / from the Bellamy Band Book -- Yankee Doodle / version found in the Bellamy Band Book.

Score is for the New Haven march only. Parts are for 2 violins, 2 flutes, clarinet and bass. Clarinet and bass parts have only the pieces from the Bellamy Band book, flute parts have all but the Duettino and the Duetto. Violin parts have all the pieces.

The temperance harp: original and selected music, designed to accompany the Temperance hymn book and minstrel by Rev. John Marsh / adapted to be used in social circles, schools, and public meetings by Charles J. Warren. -- New Haven, Conn. : Hitchcock & Stafford (p), 1842.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Rule, temperance, rule / words from Temp. hymn book, music adapted -- Hurrah, for bright water / words adapted, music by C.J. Warren -- Speed, speed the temperance ship / words from Temp. hymn book, music by C.J. Warren -- Tee-total union -- Oh, wild is the path -- The first pledge / words from Temp. hymn book, music by C.J. Warren -- The blushing rose / words by Charles Thurber, Esq., music by Asa R. Trowbridge -- Crystal spring / words by Charles Thurber, Esq., music by Asa R. Trowbridge -- The drink that's in the drunkard's bowl -- Cheerily, cheerily / words from the Temp. hymn book, music by C.J. Warren -- Away the bowl -- Cold water army -- The Connecticut cold water army / words from the Temp. hymn book, music by C.J. Warren / Drink from the bubbling fountain / words by Theobold Matthew, music by C.J. Warren -- Margaret's bridal / from the Wesleyan harp -- He signs the pledge / words adapted, music by C.J. Warren -- We've burst the chain -- Cold water army pledge.
